turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about History of the Roman Empire.
turn.1: What happened during the distribution of the 4th ed. in AD?
turn.2: Aurelian reigned (270–275) through the worst of the crisis, defeating the Vandals, the Visigoths, the Palmyrenes, the Persians, and then the remainder of the Gallic Empire.
turn.3: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.4: By late 274, the Roman Empire was reunited into a single entity, and the frontier troops were back in place.
turn.5: Did they face any other problems?
turn.6: More than a century would pass before Rome again lost military ascendancy over its external enemies.
turn.8: However, dozens of formerly thriving cities, especially in the Western Empire, had been ruined, their populations dispersed and, with the breakdown of the economic system, could not be rebuilt.
turn.9: What else did you find interesting about this article?
turn.10: Major cities and towns, even Rome itself, had not needed fortifications for many centuries; many then surrounded themselves with thick walls.
turn.11: Did they need any other fortifications?
turn.12: Finally, although Aurelian had played a significant role in restoring the Empire's borders from external threat, more fundamental problems remained.
